ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Relationship of respondent to individual
Notes: 1 = Biological mom; 2 = Biological dad; 3 = Grandparent; 4 = Special education (sped) teacher; 5 = General education teacher; 6 = Occupational therapist; 7 = Speech and language therapist; 8 = Behavioral therapist; 9 = Paraprofessional; 10 = Aide; 11 = Principal; 12 = Administrator; 14 = Content teacher; 15 = Parent center director; 16 = Self; 17 = Adoptive mother; 18 = Adoptive father; 19 = Foster mother; 20 = Foster father; 21 = Grandmother; 22 = Grandfather; 23 = Step-mother; 24 = Step-father; 25 = Aunt; 26 = Uncle; 28 = Both parents; 31 = Grandmother from mother side; 32 = Grandfather from mother side; 33 = Grandmother from father side; 34 = Grandfather from father side; 36 = Brother; 37 = Sister; 38 = Cousin; 39 = Female caregiver; 40 = Male caregiver; 41 = Female child; 42 = Male child; 43 = Spouse/Mate; 44 = Friend; 45 = Parent; 46 = Significant other; 47 = Sibling; 48 = Son/Daughter; 49 = Son-in-law/Daughter-in law; 50 = Other Relative; 51 = Paid caregiver; 52 = Friends; 53 = Roommate; 54 = Supervisor; 55 = Mother's boyfriend; 56 = Other parental figure; 57 = Summary; 58 = Counselor; 59 = Other female relative; 60 = Other male relative; 61 = Non-relative ; 62 = Maternal Aunt; 63 = Maternal Uncle; 64 = Maternal Cousin; 65 = Paternal Aunt; 66 = Paternal Uncle; 67 = Paternal Cousin; 68 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Grandmother; 69 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Stepmother and Grandmother; 70 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Grandmother and Foster Father; 71 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Stepmother and Foster Mother; 72 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Foster Mother; 73 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Biological/Adoptive Father; 74 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Stepmother and Biological/Adoptive Father; 75 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Other; 76 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Stepmother and Stepfather; 77 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Stepfather; 78 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Grandfather; 79 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Stepmother and Foster Father; 80 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Stepmother; 81 = Guardian, female; 82 = Other female; 83 = Guardian, male; 84 = Other male; 85 = Other/Grandparent/Nanny; 86 = Mother, Father, Guardian; 87 = Daughter, son, grandchild; 88 = Professional (e.g., social worker, nurse, therapist, psychiatrist, or group home staff); -999 = Missing; 89 = Biological parent; 90 = Other; 91 = Stepparent; 92 = Adoptive parent; 93 = Foster parent; 94 = Co-worker; 95 = Independent Evaluator; 96 = Legal guardian

ElementDescription: Family User-Defined ID
The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for subject's biological mother
Mother's age
In the past 12 months, has mother experienced respiratory problems?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; asthma, bronchitis, emphysema, sleep apnea, or other lung problems

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced musculoskeletal problems?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; arthiritis, rheumatism, osteoporosis, sciatica, lumbargo, recurring backache or serious back trouble, and other bone or joint diseases

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced skin problems?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; persistent skin trouble

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced thyroid problems?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; thyroid disease

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced allergies?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; hay fever or other allergies

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced gastrointestinal problems?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; reoccurring stomach trouble, indigestion, diarrhea, constipation, gall bladder trouble, piles, hemorrhoids, swallowing problems, anemia, colitis

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced urinary problems?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; urinary or bladder problems

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced foot problems?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; persistent foot trouble (bunions, ingrown toenails, etc.)

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced migraines?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; migraine headaches

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced sleep problems?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; chronic sleeping problems

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced diabetes?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; diabetes or high blood sugar

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced neurological issues?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; multiple sclerosis, epilepsy, stroke, fibromyalgia, other neurological disorders

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced ulcers?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; ulcer

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced hernia?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; hernia or rupture

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced cancer?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; cancer

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced autoimmune disorders?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; lupus or other autoimmune disorders

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced mouth problems?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; persistent trouble with gums, mouth, or teeth

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced mental health issues?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; anxiety, depression, attention deficit disorder (hyperactivity), obsessive-compulsive disorder, eating disorders such as anorexia or bulimia, bipolar, schizophrenia, or another emotional disorder

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced being overweight or obese?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; trouble with being overweight or obese

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced a learning disability?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; learning disability

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced liver problems?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; chronic liver problems

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced cardiovascular problems?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; heart disease, trouble with varicose veins requiring medical treatment, high blood pressure or hypertension, high cholesterol

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has mother experienced problems with the reproductive system?
Notes: N = No; Y = Yes; endometriosis or pelvic inflammatory disease
